thread.title: Lexi Thompson wins LPGA Tour event in South Korea
thread.title_full: Lexi Thompson wins LPGA Tour event in South Korea

title: Lexi Thompson wins LPGA Tour event in South Korea
text:
Lexi Thompson breaks out of pack to win LPGA Tour event in South Korea 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS October 18, 2015 - 3:13 am EDT 
INCHEON, South Korea â€” Lexi Thompson broke out of a crowded pack Sunday to win the LPGA KEB Hana Bank Championship for her second victory of the year and sixth overall. 
The 20-year-old American closed with a 3-under 69 to beat Taiwan's Yani Tseng and South Korea's Sung Hyun Park by a stroke. Thompson finished at 15-under 273 on Sky 72's Ocean Course. Lexi Thompson of the United States watches her shot on the second hole during the final round of the LPGA KEB Hana Bank Championship golf tournament at Sky72 Golf Club in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) 
Park shot a 71, and Tseng had a 68. 
Lydia Ko missed a chance to take the top spot in the world from Inbee Park, finishing with a 72 that dropped her into a tie for fourth at 13 under with Amy Yang and Gerina Piller. 
Yang birdied the final nine holes for a 10-under 62. She tied the LPGA Tour record for consecutive birdies set by Beth Daniel in the 1999 Philips Invitational, broke the nine-hole mark for relation to par at 9 under, and matched the record for the lowest nine-hole total at 27. Yang tied the course record set by Sung Hyun Park on Thursday.
